website_summaries.verdict: Save money for supplements with these well-priced, high-quality lifting hooks.
pros: These hooks are very liberally padded for extra comfort on heavy lifts
This protects your hands and wrists from blisters, bruising, and scratches and improves versatility by transferring weight to larger muscle groups
Available in several sizes and colors
cons: Hooks fit loosely around the bar and could potentially slip off

customer_reviews.title: So effective you don't even need hands
customer_reviews.text: I love to lift weights, but unfortunately my right arm ends at the wrist and I have no right hand. I was trying to figure out a way to dead lift, and I picked up these lifting hooks. After a couple minutes of getting used to them, I am dead lifting like a champ. These folks are so effective you don't even need hands to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: These will work great if you have big hands
customer_reviews.text: These will work great if you have big hands, but if you're a woman with small hands (or just someone in general with small hands/wrists) these will not fit right. They are huge! I unfortunately had to return them because they were too big. In the photo I'm comparing them with another brand that's specifically made for women.
customer_reviews.author: GZ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: These hooks, right out of the box, look and feel very high end. The quality of the construction look and feel as though they will last many years with regular use. The fit is extremely comfortable and the way they take the weight off your grip feels very natural. If you're looking for a way to hold extra weight without taxing your grip strength so that you can isolate the muscle you're targeting, these are the way to go. The customer service & shipping time we're both excellent.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Heavier lifts with an easier grip
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to protect my elbow against medial epicondylitis caused by pulling against a closed hand grip. Now I can do heavier lifts or hangs with a looser grip. These work great. Sturdy and adjustable. Cool colors, too.
customer_reviews.author: D. Altman

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: I love Grip Power Pads products. I have purchased several pairs of gloves (I think like 5 or 6, only because one of my dogs keeps eating them, but I've learned my lesson). This is my second pair of these hooks. I use them alot, and over time, the velcro, due to overuse, can lose some of its holding power. I'm in Louisiana, so dust and humidity contributes to this. So, I just purchased this second pair. These, in my opinion, are the best on the market. When it comes to weightlifting gear, my automatic go-to is Grip Power Pad products. They are an amazing value and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: mdb_nola

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for enhanced weight training.
customer_reviews.text: This product is very helpful for those who can no longer bear the strain of heavy weights or challenging pulls with their fingers alone. The rod hooks are easy to get used to and they fit every bar and machine I have used. The padding on the wrist is quite sturdy and adequate. Though they are a bit big, even when pulled over my grip glove straps, I am quite small and this fit is better than any other I have tried. I would definitely recommend this product. Additionally, delivery was prompt and product was as described.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann W. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: These lifting hooks work great!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to help with doing pullups, and also for shrugs (with a straight Olympic bar). I looked at a few different types, including ones that had a single curved wide band of plastic/metal hook. I ended up choosing these, because of the smaller separate hooks, that allow your fingers to still grip the bar, and I'm very happy I got them. They are excellent, nice amount of padding, good wide velcro, can cinch them as tight as I want. I would definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: John Duff

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, work really well.
customer_reviews.text: Following a spinal cord injury in 2017 I’ve been experiencing difficulty working out in the gym. I have weakness in my grip so on pulling machines like the mid row and overhead lat machine, my fingers give out long before the rest of me! All that changes with the Best Weight Lifting Hooks. I saw someone using them and realized that was the solution. I just received mine and am delighted with the great quality and excellent value for the money. I would recommend these grips for anyone who wants to lessen the stress on their fingers while working out.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Protect your wrists, but there's an added benefit
customer_reviews.text: My trainer loved that these kept me from bending my wrists when lifting weights (when I should be keeping them straight), but I could immediately tell a huge difference in the muscles used as I lifted. The straps put the strain on my grip so I could focus on the muscles lifting the weight. My grip got less of a workout but everything else worked much harder...which is the point. Loved this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GingerGarrett

customer_reviews.title: elbow rehab
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to try and allow my elbows ( golfers elbow) to heal while still lifting. For certain exercises it works perfect, but because of the grip design it is cumbersome in any movements that are not in a straight line. Cable rows perfect, cleans are out. So through out my workout I am putting on or taking off but it does seam to help relive my grip problems.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Cloud

customer_reviews.title: great for dead lifts
customer_reviews.text: just got this in the mail and i love it. I have a weak grip so when i do dead lifts my grip tends to get weak after awhile and when the weight gets heavy. I used these hooks yesterday and i was able to lift 315 lbs my best yet. Now they are not perfect the hooks make griping with your hands difficult as it pinches your hand ive been trying different ways to approach the grip so my hands do not get pinched. But overall nice fit they are marked left and right hand comfortable on the wrist. would recommend if you have a weak grip
customer_reviews.author: Eugene K. Babineaux

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Kick ass. I am a smaller stature female power lifter with small hands. Now im able to move heavier weight without fear of my grip slipping and dropping 300lbs lol
customer_reviews.author: MrsFritz

customer_reviews.title: These things WORK!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have terrible arthritis and an 865lbs dead-lift that is so far in my rear view mirrror that I cant even lift half that anymore. My condition keeps getting worse and I had all but given up on dead-lifts in particular but also lifting in general just because losing my grip strength is so discouraging, but then I see these, they are literally a GOD send for me!! Deads, rows, pull ups and anything requiring a grip are now on the table for me. I bought both kinds-these with the hooks and the others with the cobra looking grip. Both work equally well but I think I prefer the hooks just because I can feel the bar with my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: scott g mahar

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: So, you will definitely have to have patience and work these in because they are really stiff at first. Their sturdiness is wonderful and they are very helpful in my form when doing arm and back workouts. Just give these some time to break in, get a little creative with positioning them, and you will eventually get used to them.
customer_reviews.author: VivalaDittrich

customer_reviews.title: Love the pink! High quality
customer_reviews.text: Happy, loved them. I do wish the Velcro was reversed; so when you are using them the extra space on the Velcro was the soft side not the hook side, because the hook side catches on my clothes. They seem extremely sturdy and high quality. I really only need this for my deadlifts so far and dumbbell squats, but possibly as I grow more muscle I will have more use for them. Super cute.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer N. Edmondson

customer_reviews.title: You've got to try these hooks, you will love them!!!
customer_reviews.text: These hooks are just plain awesome. These replace some hooks that I have had for probably 15 years, and wow, what an improvement. With the neoprene I no longer go home from the gym on back day with red scrapped wrists. I highly recommend that you give these a try, you will love them
customer_reviews.author: dtrumpster

customer_reviews.title: Hooks are not comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I understand the hooks are supposed to help lift. The challenge is that the hooks are metal and dig into the hands. The hooks also make finger placement awkward. My hands are ML. I suppose if I had large paws, these hook straps would be great. The hooks are also not slip proof when pulling an overhead bar, like for lats.
customer_reviews.author: A.N.V.

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: These are great rod hooks ! I have used your steel hooks prior to his and liked them alot. I'm still getting comfortable with the feel of the rod hooks because of the difference in construction, hence the 4 star vs 5 star rating I gave the steel hooks. I like the simplicity and decrease in weight over the steel hooks. Durability is important to me and I haven't had them long enough to comment. Based on the construction I expect the durability to be excellen.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Originally i bought another brand that didn't have the ring which is critical for a tight fit on the wrists and doesn't slide while lifting. These are a little more heavy duty than i personally need but friends can borrow them no matter how heavy they are lifting or lat pulldowns. For me, i need them on the days that work has trashed my firearms nut i still need to work the rest of my body at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: In love with snow

customer_reviews.title: Great for post wrist injury
customer_reviews.text: After sustaining several wrist injuries, my grip strength isn't what it used to be. I typically use Versagrips for many of my "pulling" exercises (ie; pulldowns, rows, incline pulls--even light deadlifts), but the still allowed my "weak" wrist to grab things differently from my good wrist, and my back was beginning to develop slightly unevenly. These were helpful because I don't even need to grab the attachment/dumbell/barbell if I don't want to which allows me to focus on contracting my back evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy M.

customer_reviews.title: BEST equipment I carry in the gym bag
customer_reviews.text: BEST equipment I carry in the gym bag !! This is GREAT for conventional dead-lifts, sumo dead-lifts and stiff legged DL. It saves my wrist from taking the strain, I was having sore wrists from lifting heavy with straps. I went from gloves, to straps, then gloves with reinforced Velcro wrist straps (it still wasn't comfortable) NOW, I use them for pull ups....no more pain !! No one else at my gym uses them and I was a little shy bringing them out in public, BUT now I proudly wear them!!!
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Best Grip Aid
customer_reviews.text: These help out a lot since now I don’t have to rely on my grip strength. My hands can’t seem to match the strength of my calves or my traps when I work them with a barbell. I wonder if 20 years from now, I’ll have wrist pain not knowing my wrists weren’t meant for that kind of work but that will only be because these worked so great.
customer_reviews.author: CaliforniaTexan

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed and durable. Can't understand how these are half the price of other brands since they are just as strong as others. I have owned several other brands of these hooks ( they were lost or stolen while at the gym) and paid up to twice as much for the same quality. When I was looking for a new pair I was actually afraid to buy these since they were so inexpensive. Thought they would be cheaply made. These are excellent quality and should last me a long time. So far I have been pulling up to 100 lbs of dumbbells on these w/o problem as well as assisting me on pullups ( I weigh 200 lbs).
customer_reviews.author: arnisdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Well made, You get what you expect, Priced nicely
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what they say you get.. Hooks fit nicely on all our X-port gym bars and wrist support straps are padded well to protect them. So far we love everything we have gotten from Grip Power Pads and recommend them to all our gym buddies. Can NOT go wrong buying from these guys. Awesome customer support too.
customer_reviews.author: carol powers

customer_reviews.title: That the materials used were not sturdy or durable 4 long continuous use.
customer_reviews.text: The workmanship of this product was inferior. The product straps and brackets did not support heavy lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Chill

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Although I am not using this for the purpose it is intended for , I will say they are well made and comfortable. Appearance is very nice , padding is quite good . I am using this for a hook type use (left hand hemiplegia) on my kayak paddle so I can stroke with the paddle without actually being attached to it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it!  So glad I bought them!
customer_reviews.text: These are such a huge help! I was really struggling to go up in weights because my grip would fail, these hooks have allowed me to increase weight for my deadlift and renegade rows by 10%. Also help with my callouses which really impacted my lifting. Totally recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. HURT.
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste you're money. Looks like a great idea but it was poorly done. Once you start to sweat they try to slide off and cause discomfort to the thumb. Also the hook portion needs to be redesigned. It poorly saddled bar. Wasted my money on these.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Conley

customer_reviews.title: Threading coming off
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these!!!! But after a few months, the threads are coming off from the fabric that is actually holding the metal hooks. That makes me very sad :(
customer_reviews.author: Saif Kato

customer_reviews.title: Increased my weight!
customer_reviews.text: Went up in weight on all of my pulling exercises for back day! Happy to say my back is sore for the first time in months. The hooks felt comfortable and secure throughout my workout. I bought the size small with the double hooks, I’m around 125 pounds and these fit perfectly. My only regret is not buying a set sooner.
customer_reviews.author: BusyBones

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: These grip hooks are a game changer! The wrist padding is comfy, padding on the hooks makes for no clinking of metals sound. Wish the hooks came in a few different sizes as I have petite hands. Definitely recommend to anyone looking to improve their grip while strength training.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: These have saved my hands/wrists at the gym. I suffer from carpal tunnel and have a lot of problems with grip, with these hooks I can do pull downs, rows, etc... with no wrist pain. Bonus is they are very affordable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: AJ McC.

customer_reviews.title: Saves my hands so I can lift longer
customer_reviews.text: My job requires constant use of my hands. They are often very sore. These hooks fit my small wrists (5’5” 120#) really well & save my hands when I’m lifting. Very study. If I had to complain.. the hooks should be a bit longer to fit into my palms a litter better.
customer_reviews.author: Jenniferr817

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent well made product....
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that the Pro Secure Your Grip from Grip Power Pads are padded and very comfortable. The hooks are solid steel and capably rated to a pull ratio of 600 lbs. I use mine for shoulder shrugs, lat pull downs and dead lifts.....They take the stress and strain off of my hands and wrists and allow me to use more weight and do more reps without my hands and fingers starting to loose grip..... I would highly recommend this product to all Gym Rats......
customer_reviews.author: Gene B. Geldziler

customer_reviews.title: Strong hooks
customer_reviews.text: These are more or less a game changer for me. THe hooks can support the weight on their own, so they help a lot for me when I'm strugging heavy weights. Normally my hands would slip and I'd have to re-rack the weights, but this eliminated the issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrick

customer_reviews.title: Not for pull ups
customer_reviews.text: Works ok for lifting / carrying heavy weight. Good for shrugs, etc. They are comfortable on the wrists under load. It was awkward to use for pull-ups / lat pull downs. The angle of the hooks and distance from the wrist just felt off for those.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won’t hold bar once you loose grip
customer_reviews.text: These are almost perfect however, the fatal flaw is the length of fabrics holding the hooks, if you loose your grip, the bar will slip from the hooks. Harbinger clips don’t do that. Unfortunately you can tell these would last longer then harbinger clips if not for that one flaw
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are some of the best hooks I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: Well made, heavy duty, These are some of the best hooks I have ever used! Well made construction. Comfertable fit, unlike other I have had that seemed to dig into my wrist, or gotten in the way of hand thumb placement, these really do inhance your grip so you are able to focus on the targeted muscles and not worry about wrist fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: Japeth

customer_reviews.title: Many uses
customer_reviews.text: The webbing is secure and strong. The hooks are in the right place. the padding is comfortable. As a note I use these grips to hook onto a cross bar so I can do lots more leg raises. At my age my hands won't grip the bar tight enough to get in the reps I want. Thus the grips make it easier for me. The hooks make pulling easier than with my arthritic hands. Thanks for reading.
customer_reviews.author: David Hall

customer_reviews.title: Don't have to be a power lifter to benefit from these gloves.  Better than straps for inadequate grip strength.
customer_reviews.text: You don't have to be a pro-lifter to benefit from these gloves. My grip strength is simply not where I need it and it was impacting my "pull" sessions. I tried weightlifting straps - but found them a bit annoying to use and not really that effective. These rod hooks, on the other hand, are awesome. Enabled me to get through my entire routine with more weight - without pain or forearm cramping. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C. Kortright

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a little finger sprain I'm working through and these have been great for that reason, but I plan on using them after I have healed. They are very sturdy and well made. I am a small female who wears a size small lifting glove. I was concerned the hooks were going to be uncomfortably large for my hands to curve around but that is not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren C

customer_reviews.title: Solid Hooks for Unusual Use
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of Kettle Bell swings with 55-60lb kettle bells and Grip Power Pads are the only thing that save my hands from total destruction. The wrist wrap and hooks are really durable ...doing 1,000 swings at a time the wrap is going to wear out at some point, however the Grip Power Pads are the longest lasting and most durable. If you are using this for regular power lifting they will last lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: batton93

customer_reviews.title: Does the job - Excellent design
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. I was having trouble wrapping my hands around certain weight machine handles, resulting in aching forearms. These hooks take the strain off so you can focus on the muscles that you're trying to work on. I am now able to lift heavier weights. Another good thing is that I don't need to take them off between sets. The hooks hang below your wrists so they don't get in the way of doing other workouts.
customer_reviews.author: CURLY LOO

customer_reviews.title: My tennis elbow did not want me to Lift weights!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, actually my tendon problem did not want me to do pulling exercises (Lat and back). But this solves that problem. Elbow pain (On the outside) is stressed by tight grip. This is much more simple than straps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT, USE IT, LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.text: Helps my overall back workout days. Deadlifts, pulldowns, and rows are done much more to the max reps since my grip isn't getting fatigued mainly since our forearms and fingers will never have as much power/strength as our back. I would recommend this to anyone looking to maximize their back workout routine, even those tie around the bar straps the other guys are selling or using at the gym don't compare to this. My deadlifts went from 405 lbs and 4 reps to 505 lbs and 10 reps in a week of using these hooks.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for someone with a severe hand injury that didnt think they could lift again.
customer_reviews.text: I am really satisfied with this product. I injured my hand last year and am missing my index finger and have limited movement in my pointer and ring finger. I can lift the weight without these but the assistance holding and putting the weight down is what I needed and these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jerseyjoe68

customer_reviews.title: Great Grips!
customer_reviews.text: I began to have difficulty with my guitar playing, and I was afraid that I was losing my dexterity and was becoming concerned. I've been gym training my whole life (I'm 49) but am a relatively new guitarist so I was trying to figure out what to do... Dawned on my that the problems with my hands always followed "pull day" when I would train my back at the gym... BINGO! Shopped around, took a chance on these, and I'm very impressed with the results. Here's a video I made to show you, first-hand... I HIGHLY recommend this product! Thank You GripPower...
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: They help a lot, but they cut the circulation after a while, whether I tighten or loosen them. I have arthritis and use them on the rowing machine. I would like to see wider wraps on the market so that the pull is distributed over most of my forearm. I think that would solve my problem. Overall, a great product.
customer_reviews.author: CuperLady

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love my hooks! I've lived my whole life with no fingers on my left hand and these hooks have let me continue south my lifting routines into heavy weight. I also have small wrists and these were perfect. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: They are also extremely comfortable and easy to use and don't sweat
customer_reviews.text: These Lifting Hooks feel heavy-duty right out of the package. They are also extremely comfortable and easy to use and don't sweat. These hooks are meant to support your heavy pull lifts such as deadlifts and pull-ups etc. One caveat is that they are not adjustable though my hand are medium-large and they fit me perfectly, and I think that they will fit most people. That said these are way better then the old-school lifting straps in every way, especially because they don't give you blisters or calluses. Here's a video of me using them: I would recommend these to everyone who would like to add 35 or so pounds to the're deadlifts.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM!
customer_reviews.text: Great hooks. But the hooks can be to narrow for holding free weights. They fit, but barely. maybe this helps them stay in the hooks? But slightly larger gap would help. Now I can continue to work the rest of my back muscles and curls even when my hands get exhausted. If your working out hard these really Help. You don't really need gloves with these either.
customer_reviews.author: The ELITE

customer_reviews.title: All back gains
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for a month on my back days and what I can say is that my back has never been so sore. These eliminate the forearms from helping so its all back. The only minor issue ive seen is that it may not fit some very weird cable attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Khalifa A.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for sore forearms!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used them for about a month now-they take some getting used to but when you do they are amazing. My forearms are the reason I bought them, they are shot and would burn for a week after my pull days and really never would recover. Now they don’t have to recover and I can finally lift what I’m capable of lifting instead of lowering the weight because my forearms are throbbing.
customer_reviews.author: thalsten

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Wrist Fit, Hooks a Little Big, but Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great hooks, improve my deadlifts and rows dramatically since my upper body/ grip strength was limiting my ability to lift heavier. Would love the hooks to be a tad smaller for women's smaller hands, but overall happy with my purchase, the seller, and the quality of these grips.
customer_reviews.author: NatashaG

customer_reviews.title: Great for Back n Traps
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. I can lift heavier now. My back routine are intense now. I get a great pump and able to increase my 1 and Done by almost double.
customer_reviews.author: L8TN9T

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Hooks
customer_reviews.text: Love these hooks for pull ups, dead lifts,and dumbbell rows. The neoprene padding inside is so comfortable! Awesome Logos on the wrist band, These wristbands are worth $14 all day long. 5 stars AAAAA+++++
customer_reviews.author: Christina Chapman

customer_reviews.title: I have developed some elbow problems that are aggravated by heavy/prolonged gripping like in deadlift
customer_reviews.text: These hooks work just as I hoped. Adjustable to the tight fit I wanted and seem very well made. I have developed some elbow problems that are aggravated by heavy/prolonged gripping like in deadlift. These take the strain and allow me to keep working out as I want to.
customer_reviews.author: gnk

customer_reviews.title: Work well for what they're intended for
customer_reviews.text: Got them for a friend (female) who has issues holding into weights. She says they work well.
customer_reviews.author: Truthful

customer_reviews.title: great lifting hooks
customer_reviews.text: I have try lifting hook for year and most only last 6 month at best. These are going on2 years and I just bought another pair to keep in my wife car. A must try!! love them
customer_reviews.author: Larry Minetti

customer_reviews.title: Well made and work perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been looking for hooks to allow him to do heavy back work. These took grip strength completely out of the equation and allowed him to increase his weights for all pulling exercises (bent over rows, one arm rows, etc.). Essential tool to have in the box. These hooks are well made and work perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: AMO77

customer_reviews.title: OMG AWSOME
customer_reviews.text: I like to lift some what heavy weights and I AM 55 and my hands don't want to join in lol they help my hands so much and it is much easier to lift heavy weights with no pressure ON my hands.... thanks so much .... AWSOME
customer_reviews.author: nikki

customer_reviews.title: Have shrugged 465 pounds with these
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, shrugged 465 pounds with them without issue, pretty impressed for the price. Easy to put on, even had someone else at the gym ask about them.
customer_reviews.author: David Reedy

customer_reviews.title: Poor rubber quality
customer_reviews.text: These hooks are great but the rubber lining on the hooks themselves isn't very durable. I only use the hooks on dumbbells and an Olympic bar but after only two weeks of workouts the rubber is tearing and the metal of the hooks are visible.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Fit snugly
customer_reviews.text: Loved that they fit snugly in my palm. Definitely not regretting getting the women’s fit.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, strong build, great for continuing to lift when your grip gives out. I use them for shruggs and deadlifts after my grip starts going.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Connolly

customer_reviews.title: Works as Described
customer_reviews.text: These are great for dead lifts! I have been using a buddies for years and then moved to the other side of town. I purchased these and they work great. I really like how easy they are to put on and off and the foam lining around the wrists. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: JKP

customer_reviews.title: Not like picture shown
customer_reviews.text: On the ad the hook strap is further away than mine to where it hooks to wrist. Would make it easier if longer. Seems to work ok. Hard to keep hooks even on dumbells. But it does help me grip a little better
customer_reviews.author: Beth Kastelic

customer_reviews.title: and very comfortable. You can really see and feel the quality ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried several pairs of straps and hooks before I arrived at these. These are rock solid, and very comfortable. You can really see and feel the quality with these. They do exactly what they claim- relieving your grip so you can really get a good pump in the muscles your trying to target. I can't imagine a strap or hook that is more effective than these.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: love these hooks
customer_reviews.text: love these hooks!! they are super strong, and the curve of the hook ensures a successful lift without the risk of losing the bar. so steady & reliable! wrist cuffs are a little thick for my small wrists but very secure. these seem like they will be lasting a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Eliot

customer_reviews.title: Great product  as it is described.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with these hook grips. One of the problems I had during my trainings were my wrists and hands. I knew I had the strenght to lift more weight but my hands did not allow me. With these grips, I do not strain my hands and wrists and my weight lifts are very intense.
customer_reviews.author: Nora Begona

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product - I can lift more weight
customer_reviews.text: With this product I can focus on what my arms are able to lift without being concerned about whether or not my grip is strong enough to handle the weight. The only improvement I would recommend is that the manufacturer create a different version with the hooks turned inwards instead of outwards. I have turned the hooks around, and then it works even better!
customer_reviews.author: John DiLucci

customer_reviews.title: love these
customer_reviews.text: i got these as i have arthritis in my fingers so after a few rebs my fingers start to loose there grip ,with these hooks i can hold on longer and pull more weight, i partically use them when doin back workout and deadlifts, love these things
customer_reviews.author: John Arruda

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Love these, I've bought three pairs and gifted two. They help me on days my grip can't keep up with the weight I need to pull. Love these
customer_reviews.author: AmberJo

customer_reviews.title: Great product, they work more or less exactly like ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, they work more or less exactly like described, and don't feel awkward or poorly engineered. Well made, I don't know how long the rubber will last on the hooks but I'm sure it can be replaced with some type of hose/line. I never even heard of these, just stumbled on them looking for gloves. Very happy! Thanks guys
customer_reviews.author: Ralph S.

customer_reviews.title: Great hand support, a must for everyone!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well made product. Have used it in the gym several times, very comfortable and strong. If you want to rep out ,and really get the most from your work use these hooks! Your grip will give out, these won't!!! If you don't have them or never used hooks try them out and see the difference it will make. I work out hardcore so I can't use cheap equipment. This is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for over 225 lbs lift.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, uncomfortable in the wrist, with heavy weight. Definitely not for pull ups.
customer_reviews.author: Dynamita84

customer_reviews.title: Simple Fix for Grip Strength
customer_reviews.text: These grips are great for numerous reason. Firstly, they allow you eliminate the grip/forearm strength required when targeting other muscle groups. So, if I want to hit ONLY back during weighted pull ups, these guys a great help. Secondly, they are very simple to use. They strap on in seconds and are quite comfortable. I've used them for weighted pull ups, deadlifts, and dumbbell shrugs. They've even helped reduce pain at my medial epicondyle (golfer's elbow). I believe these are a great tool for the avid gym goer. My video review: [...]
customer_reviews.author: The Hammers

customer_reviews.title: Incredible product!
customer_reviews.text: These rods are life-changing in the gym. I’m stronger than my grip, and I have a bone spur on one of my fingers that affects my ability to hold the amount of weight I can actually handle. These grips allow me to pull sooo much more weight - controlled, strong, etc. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I had a motorcycle accident a few years ago and suffered broken wrists, with the help of this product I have been able to lift with a lot more comfort and way more weight. This is my second pair, I lost my first pair.
customer_reviews.author: Vega

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Solid Sturdy product. Great accessory equipment for building your larger group muscles like your lats. Also great for doing hanging leg raises for abs. Easy to use and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Jin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I received my power grips extremely fast and upon use they work out just how you’d expect! Bent over barbell rows are now 100% focusing my back muscle with these and it takes away that arm fatigue and forearm fatigue from doing shrugs or deadlifting. Would recommend purchasing
customer_reviews.author: Mamaturk

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: I’m both a trainer + bodybuilder. These work amazing not only for me, but for my clients.
customer_reviews.author: SamIam

customer_reviews.title: Confortable, and very helpful. So far I love the quality!
customer_reviews.text: I work as a trainer and I really liked this product. It not only has the hook it also supports my wrist very well. Even doe I have not used it a lot due to time, I find it helps me go heavier in certain exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Carrera

customer_reviews.title: Not just for power lifting
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic value. I don't see it mentioned much here, but my physical therapist suggested I try these to help with my medial epicondilitis (golfers elbow). These take the pulling strain off my forearm and help redirect to my scaps, allowing me to at least do light deadlifting again. Looking forward to really putting through the paces. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: B. Sproat

customer_reviews.title: A++
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several lifting hooks but these set is far the best!
customer_reviews.author: Norma A. Muhlenbruch

customer_reviews.title: These Grip Power Pads are great
customer_reviews.text: I love these grip power pads!!! They arrived to me quick. I used them and they helped me out with lifting heavier without hurting myself. Also, the bar will not get caught in the hooks because how they are built. Anyone who is is looking for a great tool to help in the gym, i highly recommend Grip Power Pads!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love it because with my thumb was bad to help me grab the bar for deadlifts and shrugs
customer_reviews.author: Jaime D. Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Hang on to these. Get it? Hang on? C’mon
customer_reviews.text: First hooked wraps that truly work. If you have arthritis in your hands and still want to lift, this is your guy.
customer_reviews.author: derek kanady

customer_reviews.title: Bag looks like already opened/slashed and only one hook was in the
customer_reviews.text: Not sure who dropped the ball. Bag looks like already opened/slashed and only one hook was in the box
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: The Hooks-Great Quality at an extremely awesome price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife. She is constantly reading some type of body building article on line or in one of our Men's/Women's Health magazines and utilizing hooks was represented. So she purchased a set at DICKS Sporting goods without knowing I ordered these from you. She took the ones from DICKS back and kept these. She said the hook engaged the bars much better, and the padding is much more superior. Now I hope these hold up. Thanks again.
customer_reviews.author: whiplash

customer_reviews.title: Tennis elbow ... Great for side lateral raises
customer_reviews.text: I have stopped doing side lateral raises due to tennis elbow. Now this solved the problem. I also use it for dumbbell upright raw as it gives great feel. Other than that tie straps beat it hard. But every vehicle takes u to a specific destination.
customer_reviews.author: Bassam

customer_reviews.title: The best price and very well made!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best price you get out there and the comfort this thing gives you is amazing and the material used in this thing don't look cheap it's worth the money very durable you'll get a good worth workout using it if you're grip is weak
customer_reviews.author: Kervin

customer_reviews.title: Get a grip
customer_reviews.text: Well I'm almost 59 and back to bodybuilding after 30 years. These hooks are the cat's meow and allow you to get a few more reps with each set. A few more reps means gains and gains leads to growth. Get a pair and buy a pair they're worth it.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Great Grip
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my daily hanging exercise. My hands had been slipping...now the wrist pads and hooks help me stay the course. They work very well and they are a nice fit.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Hull

customer_reviews.title: was a must for me
customer_reviews.text: I am an intermediate level lifter and this product allows for me to lift weights beyond my grip strength. Before these I was pulling & lifting well below my weight limit. They are comfortable, adjustable, and so far durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ed M.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and useful
customer_reviews.text: Since I am missing the digits to enable a grip, I am using these to deadlift and do other things like dumbbells and pullups. Work well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful if you have wrist pain
customer_reviews.text: I have fibro and have some issues with my wrists and weakness when having a flare. These help tremendously and rather than lifting lighter to accommodate the wrists, I can lift heavier and actually get a better workout now and make progress with my muscle development.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Not effective
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like it , it hurts your wrist and it’s useless
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saves your grip
customer_reviews.text: Love them!! Takes pressure off hands and spreads it onto wrist area
customer_reviews.author: @SarahLucero

customer_reviews.title: Works great if you want to increase muscle time under tension ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great if you want to increase muscle time under tension for any pull-type of motion. However, you still need to do the work, so don't expect to be able to add 50-100 lbs to your deadlift just because of the hooks. I found it to work the best when you pick weight you're comfortable doing 8-10 reps, and those hooks will allow you to do 12-15 reps (whatever pull ex you're doing)
customer_reviews.author: Roman

product_meta.title: Best Weight Lifting Rod Hooks Heavy Duty Wrist Wraps Power Weight Lifting Training Gym Grips Straps Set of 2
product_meta.description: Designed for Men & Women Please choose model that you like These lifting hooks are specifically designed for men & women (or anyone with a large or SMALL wrist size). Enjoy a superior quality grip and get the support you need with every workout. The best part: Our lifting hooks are padded, so you’ll feel comfortable as soon as you put them on. Now you’ll be able to focus on your workouts again! Engage More Muscles Our lifting hooks are designed to distribute weight around your wrists. This allows you to use an open-handed grip while lifting weights. They also help prevent lifting from causing too much tension in your back, forearms and biceps. You’ll get maximum results with every rep! Color Options Not only will you feel good when you use our lifting grips, but you’ll look good too! Our ROD Lifting Hooks for Men& Women come in four colors to match your workout clothes: black, blue, red, orange and pink. Prevent Further Injury Lifting hooks are ideal for anyone training with an injury. If you have tendonitis, carpal tunnel, or arthritis, our product will ease the strain – allowing you to continue training while you heal.
feature_bullets: Weight Lifting Hooks for Grip Assist During Rows, Deadlifts, Shrugs, and Pulldowns!

GET THE ADDED SUPPORT YOU NEED! Grip Power Pads ROD Lifting Hooks for Men & Women are designed to provide support and assistance while you work out. They take the strain off your wrists when lifting weights or performing deadlifts, pulldowns, rows, or shrugs – making it simple to avoid injury and better engage the muscles you’re targeting!
WORK OUT BETTER WITH WELL-DESIGNED HOOKS. Our hooks are designed to fit perfectly onto machine attachments and free weights such as barbells and dumbbells.

ALLEVIATE YOUR PAIN. If you have golfers elbow or tendonitis, you can take strain off your wrists when you lift with our ROD Lifting Hooks for Men & Women. They transfer the weight to larger muscle groups so your wrists won’t have to do all the work.

SEE IMPROVEMENTS WITH EACH WORKOUT. Because our lifting hooks provide assistance when lifting weights, you can gradually increase the weight you‘re using. Get ready to see substantial improvements to your workout routine over time!
